modules.description: This module provides direct control over terminal display and cursor positioning through functions like clearing the screen, moving the cursor, and switching to an alternate screen buffer. It operates on terminal output streams to manipulate visual presentation and state. Concrete use cases include building text-based user interfaces, progress displays, and interactive command-line tools with dynamic screen updates.

Represents terminal color profiles and provides functions to load the current environment's profile, access a default profile, and convert colors between profiles. Works with `Tty.Profile.t` and `Tty.Color.t` types to handle color transformations. Useful for applications that need to adapt terminal color output based on the detected or configured terminal profile.

Reads UTF-8 input from standard input with non-blocking behavior, returning either a string, end-of-input, retry signal, or malformed data. It works directly with Unix terminal I/O settings to enable async reading. Use this for interactive command-line applications needing precise control over input handling and terminal state.

This module defines color representations for terminal output, supporting RGB, ANSI, and 256-color modes. It includes functions to construct colors from strings or RGB tuples, check color types, and render colors as escape sequences for foreground or background text styling. Use cases include generating colored terminal output based on user preferences or dynamic theme settings.

This module offers operations for text styling (bold, colors), cursor movement (positioning, line deletion), and terminal feature control (mouse support, scrolling regions) through ANSI escape sequences. It manipulates terminal display and cursor state directly, using string-based sequences and parameters like line counts or color codes. Commonly used for building interactive command-line interfaces, text editors, or terminal emulators with dynamic screen updates and user input handling.

This module enables low-level terminal manipulation by combining display control, color management, and input handling. It supports dynamic screen updates with cursor positioning, text styling, and color transformations across different terminal profiles. Key data types include `Tty.Color.t` for color representations and `Tty.Profile.t` for terminal color profiles. You can build interactive command-line applications that handle colored output, styled text, and real-time input with precise control over terminal state and appearance.
